title: Dumpy: A Compact and Scalable Index for Large Collections of Time Series
abstract: Time series data management has become increasingly important with the proliferation of IoT devices and monitoring systems. This paper presents Dumpy, a novel indexing structure for large collections of time series that achieves both compactness and scalability. Our approach significantly outperforms existing methods in both storage efficiency and query performance.

title: Large Language Models for Intelligent Operations: Opportunities and Challenges
abstract: Large language models have shown remarkable capabilities in various domains. This paper explores their potential applications in intelligent operations, discussing both opportunities and challenges in deploying LLMs for IT system management and automation.

title: Scalable Time Series Similarity Search with Apache IoTDB
abstract: Time series similarity search is a fundamental operation in many applications. This paper presents a scalable approach integrated with Apache IoTDB that supports efficient similarity search over massive time series collections. Our method achieves orders of magnitude speedup compared to existing solutions.

title: Intelligent Operations: A Survey of AI Techniques for IT System Management
abstract: The complexity of modern IT systems has made traditional operations management approaches insufficient. This survey provides a comprehensive overview of AI techniques for intelligent operations, covering anomaly detection, root cause analysis, and automated remediation.

title: DSTree: A Tree Data Structure for the Efficient Management of Large Time Series Databases
abstract: Managing large-scale time series databases efficiently is a critical challenge in modern data management systems. We propose DSTree, a novel tree-based data structure that provides efficient storage and query capabilities for time series data. Extensive experiments demonstrate the superiority of our approach.

title: Manufacturing Data Analytics: From Sensors to Insights
abstract: The manufacturing industry generates vast amounts of sensor data that can provide valuable insights for process optimization and quality control. This paper presents a comprehensive framework for manufacturing data analytics, from data collection to actionable insights.

title: Efficient Alert Correlation and Root Cause Analysis Using Causal Discovery
abstract: In large-scale IT systems, alert storms during failures make root cause analysis extremely challenging. This paper proposes a novel approach using causal discovery to efficiently correlate alerts and identify root causes. Our method significantly reduces the time to resolution in production environments.

title: Time Series Data Management in Apache IoTDB: Design and Implementation
abstract: Apache IoTDB is an open-source time series database designed for IoT applications. This paper presents the design and implementation of IoTDB, focusing on its storage engine, query processing, and system architecture. Extensive experiments demonstrate its effectiveness in real-world scenarios.

title: Industrial Time Series Anomaly Detection: A Deep Learning Approach
abstract: Anomaly detection in industrial time series is crucial for predictive maintenance and quality control. This paper presents a deep learning-based approach that combines autoencoders with attention mechanisms to achieve state-of-the-art performance on real-world industrial datasets.

title: KV-match: A Subsequence Matching Approach Supporting Normalization and Time Warping
abstract: Subsequence matching in time series is a fundamental operation in many applications. This paper presents KV-match, a novel approach that supports both normalization and time warping for more flexible and accurate matching. Our method achieves significant improvements in both accuracy and efficiency.
